Class LinkedListMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd211Methods.LinkedListMethods

  • public class LinkedListMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    Some basic methods we will need to use in conjunction with the LinkedList class NOTE all parameters will be final and all preconditions will be enforced

    • Method Detail

      • menu

        public static int menu(java.util.Scanner kb)
        menu method for testing your linked list
        1) Print the List
        2) Append the specified element to the end of this list.
        3) addAll(index, array)
        4) Read an index and get the data at that index
        5) getLast
        6) remove
        7) removeIndex
        8) removeLast
        9) toArray
        10) removeAllOccurrences
        11) clear the list
        12) Quit
        You must ensure the value entered is within range
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner Object
        Returns:
        int The choice
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null

      • readIndex

        public static int readIndex(java.util.Scanner kb)
        readIndex reads a value greater than -1
        Parameters:
        kb - The Scanner object
        Returns:
        int The index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null

      • fillArray

        public static void fillArray(java.util.Scanner kb,
                             java.lang.Integer[] array)
        Fill the array fills the passed in array with Integers by prompting the user to enter an int and then building an Integer
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner
        array - Representing an array of Integers
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if total less than 1 or kb is null

      • createInteger

        public static java.lang.Integer createInteger(java.util.Scanner kb)
        This method prompts the user for an int and builds and returns an Integer with that value
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner to the keyboard
        Returns:
        Integer Representing the desired entered value by the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null

      • fillArray

        public static java.lang.Integer[] fillArray(java.util.Scanner kb,
                                            int total)
        Fill the array creates an array of Integers and fills the array with values entered by the user.
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner
        total - Representing the total size of the array to make
        Returns:
        Integer[] The array of Integers
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if total less than 1 or kb is null
